{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you're looking for a way out to streamline workflows and improve software quality, use CI/CD tools in your development process. These tools automate routine tasks, helping to reduce errors, save time, and deliver reliable updates.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This article explores some of the most popular CI/CD tools, their features, and how they can be integrated with ReportPortal to enhance test management and reporting.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is CI/CD tools?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"CI/CD tools are software solutions that automate key stages of the development lifecycle, facilitating Continuous Integration (regular merging, building, and testing of code) and Continuous Deployment (automatic delivery of tested code to production), ensuring faster and more reliable updates.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Benefits of CI/CD tools","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"CI/CD tools offer numerous advantages that streamline software development and deployment.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Saved time","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Automate repetitive tasks like testing and deployment, reducing manual work and mistakes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Faster releases","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Speed up updates and new feature rollouts to meet user and market demands.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Better quality","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Catch and fix issues early with automated testing, leading to more reliable software.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Enhanced coordination","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Improve collaboration between developers and operations teams with clear, streamlined workflows.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Fewer deployment errors","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Minimize risks during updates with stable, automated deployment processes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Let’s review some of the most popular CI/CD platforms:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Jenkins","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Azure DevOps","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"GitHub Actions","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"GitLab CI","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"CircleCI","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Bitrise CI/CD","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. leadParagraph.leadParagraph: If you're looking for a way out to streamline workflows and improve software quality, use CI/CD tools in your development process. These tools automate routine tasks, helping to reduce errors, save time, and deliver reliable updates.

articleBody.raw:
{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In software development, testing is key to making sure a product works well and meets quality standards. There are two main ways to do this: manual testing and automation testing. Both focus on catching errors, but they work differently and are better suited for different situations. This article breaks down the differences.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is manual testing?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Manual testing is when QA testers check software step by step, without using tools to automate the process. The goal is to find bugs before the product is released. Testers focus on the most important features and write reports about any problems. This method is slower and takes more effort compared to automated testing.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is automation testing?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Automation testing uses tools and scripts to perform tests automatically. It helps testers run more tests faster and covers more ground than manual testing. This method is especially useful for tasks that need to be repeated or involve large-scale testing.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Advantages of manual testing","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"ordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Human insight","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Testers can look at the software like a real user would and spot issues with usability that tools might miss. They can also identify related bugs. Automation checks only what it’s programmed to, so if something isn’t included in the test script, the bug won’t be found. That’s why manual testing is important to catch issues that automated tests might overlook.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Flexibility","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Manual testing is better for exploring new features or cases where you don’t have a clear plan yet.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lower initial cost","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
It doesn’t need any special tools, making it cheaper for small projects or teams with tight budgets.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Advantages of automation testing","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"ordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Speed and efficiency","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Automated tests are much faster, especially for repeated tasks like regression testing.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Consistency","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Automated tools give you the same results every time, reducing the chance of mistakes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Reusability","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Once you’ve written a script, you can use it again for future tests, saving time and effort.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Scalability","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Automation handles large and complex tests better, running multiple tests at once if needed.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Differences between manual and automation testing
","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"table","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-row","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-header-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Aspect","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-header-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Manual testing","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-header-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Automation testing","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-row","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Execution","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Performed by human testers.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Performed by automated tools or scripts, although the scripts are written by automation engineers.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-row","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Speed","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Slower tasks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Higher initial cost but lower long-term costs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-row","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Error Proneness","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Prone to human errors.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Minimizes human errors.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-row","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Best testing.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"table-cell","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Regression testing, load testing, and large-scale applications.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Can automation testing replace manual testing?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Automation testing can’t fully replace manual testing because both have their strengths. Manual testing is better for complicated cases that need human judgment, while automation is great for repetitive tasks. A mix of both methods gives the best results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Continuous testing vs test automation","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Continuous testing takes automation to the next level. It involves running automated tests constantly during development to catch issues early. This approach is essential in Agile environments, helping teams release high-quality software quickly. Test automation reporting tools like ReportPortal can assist you in optimizing this process. 

Here’s how ReportPortal contributes to continuous testing:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"ordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Real-time insights","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
ReportPortal shows test results instantly, helping teams spot issues early.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"AI-based defects triage","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
It ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/analysis/AutoAnalysisOfLaunches/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"uses AI","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" to classify test failures, saving time on manual checks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Centralized results","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
All test results are stored in one place for easier tracking and visibility.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Test report dashboard","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"

Helps identify ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/FlakyTestCasesTableTop50/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"flaky tests","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":", ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/MostFailedTestCasesTableTop50/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"most failed","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" test cases, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/MostTimeConsumingTestCasesWidgetTop20/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"most time-consuming","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" test cases to improve test automation.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Using a mix of manual, automated, and continuous testing strategies helps teams create better software faster and more efficiently. By combining these methods, teams can adapt to project needs, streamline workflow, and maintain high standards.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: In software development, testing is key to making sure a product works well and meets quality standards. There are two main ways to do this: manual testing and automation testing.

articleBody.raw:
{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first step in using ReportPortal is reporting your test results. For example, results can be sent to ReportPortal through test frameworks for Java, JavaScript, .NET, Python, PHP, and others. Once your test data is submitted, you can take advantage of ReportPortal’s powerful capabilities for analyzing and visualizing test results.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Why use ReportPortal for test results?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ReportPortal helps teams manage and visualize test results in one place. Its easy-to-use dashboard and real-time analytics make it simple to understand testing progress and make better decisions.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CMDa5ZUUOh0"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Watch our video on test result visualization!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With AI-powered features, ReportPortal makes analyzing test results faster and smarter by automatically identifying reasons for test failures. The better your test data is structured, the more valuable insights you’ll get from ReportPortal’s visualizations. For this reason, following ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"best practices in reporting","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" is crucial to achieving better visualization.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use Consistent Launch Names","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leverage Attributes","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Reporting best practices for greater visualization","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using consistent Launch names","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Imagine a team running end-to-end (E2E) tests. Each test execution creates a new launch in ReportPortal. To ensure the "Latest launches" feature works effectively, the launch names should remain consistent across runs. Avoid dynamic values like timestamps or build numbers in launch names – instead, use attributes for these details.

Why does this matter? Maintaining consistent launch names is crucial for effectively utilizing the "Latest launches" feature, which displays only the most recent launches based on their names. It also facilitates tracking the history of a test case through the same launch, in addition to viewing it across all launches.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://demo.reportportal.io/ui/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ReportPortal's demo instance","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" demonstrates these capabilities. By signing up through GitHub, users can explore how features like "Latest launches" streamline test tracking. For instance, four launches – two for E2E tests and two for Unit tests – can be reported.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7FIIAWr649RGA9N7NAMvWp","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using the "Latest launches" control, users can focus only on the most recent executions for each launch name. This feature simplifies tracking when numerous launches are reported, and it can also be used to configure widgets.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"73SJR4gMuaSpy0hKb4ziMO","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ReportPortal's Analyzer can also be configured to work with launches that share consistent names, enabling more targeted decision-making. Additionally, Notification and Quality Gate rules should be set up for launches with specific names.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5UobElGNtxM3UlIT4KJQMC","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leveraging attributes","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ReportPortal attributes is a powerful feature that allows users to add metadata to their test results in a structured way. Like tags in automation frameworks, attributes in ReportPortal are used to categorize and filter test data, but they offer a bit more flexibility and detail. Attributes in ReportPortal are defined in a ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"key:value","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" format, which allows for more precise classification and retrieval of test information.

A small project with E2E and Unit tests written using Playwright and Node.js can serve as an example for updating the ReportPortal configuration with meaningful attributes. The product type, such as ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"app: shop","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", can be predefined, with additional dynamic values – like ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"build number, platform, branch, sprint","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" – being derived from environment variables.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"31YXJQ7jiBcUk9LTrUqAbQ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6I5vBB3aLCVhePX1CaApaU","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Consider a scenario where different teams contribute their tests to a single repository, and these tests are executed in a collective suite and reported as a single launch in ReportPortal.

In this case it would be helpful to attach attributes at the test level to later distinguish which team the tests belong to. Add t","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"eam, feature, priority, scenario","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" attributes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3wwpJCY92I8U7WxJLKhDGU","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For users working with Playwright or Cypress, there are separate videos demonstrating how to include attributes and additional data in test results: one for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UdeRKqFVcuU"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Playwright","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and another for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BNQpsVDMQ4E"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Cypress","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Additionally, there is separate documentation for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/log-data-in-reportportal/test-framework-integration/JavaScript/Playwright/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Playwright","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/log-data-in-reportportal/test-framework-integration/JavaScript/Cypress/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Cypress,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" as well as for other ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/log-data-in-reportportal/test-framework-integration/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"test frameworks","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".

After adding attributes and running tests, the ReportPortal UI displays these attributes. To check the test attributes, we need to drill down to the launch. They are presented under the test name and can also be used for filtering the list.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"798e2w3PUJsjXpC4gkwIZQ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At the launch level, attributes can be used to filter the launch list directly.

To use these attributes effectively, saved searches for launches, called "Filters", can be created in ReportPortal. For instance, if you want information specifically about the E2E tests, create a filter for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"E2E shop tests","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1mel2VlhSuRHwoFsabYveu","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To gather a broader overview, create another filter that displays all the launches for our application, simply by using our common attribute ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"app: shop","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" and name it as ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"All shop tests","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"C1pcI6XFGTOCMrZJgU7Sp","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7uWjt7JEXfpSGPJHblYB8E","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"How to visualize test results with attributes","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After these preparations, widgets can be created to visualize the data.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Component Health Check widget","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For example, Component Health Check and his big brother – Component Health Check (table view). Any attributes can be used to build the structure that addresses your needs.

You can create a widget for each existing filter right on the Launches page.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6z7KLsB86OurwelFyU5q6B","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As one example, the E2E filter can be selected to create the Component Health Check widget based on it. Filter conditions can be edited directly if changes are needed in the selection of launches. The option "Latest launches" can be applied to focus the widget on the most recent results.

Additional levels, such as ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"feature, priority, platform, team","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", and ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"scenario","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", can be added. All ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"features","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" are displayed, and selecting one allows viewing the tests' passing rates for different ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"priorities","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2pQyVojE3j4aZZEBvZ3Hu5","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1mkEpT7a0bFtH8fmybbbM5","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Further exploration reveals execution results for each ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"platform","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4mCAHIdayfML3Z4UndqNRY","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"If identifying the responsible ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"team","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" is necessary, deeper levels can be accessed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4kjRLPZtkaiztDV8zFlBDz","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Once the target group is located, the test results list can be accessed for further investigation by clicking the "Open list button". This option is available from any level.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2R8uDeC36dLsJRcP1sC1mQ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5NAYlGQcukrlPMN1w7kioH","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This process demonstrates how any structure can be built with the Component Health Check widget by using correctly specified attributes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Component Health Check table view widget","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Next, let’s build ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/TableComponentHealthCheck/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Component Health Check table view widget","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". It presents detailed statistics of the application components which are indicated by the specified attributes. Although it is like the previous widget, this one shows more data, including issue statistics.

For this widget, the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"All shop tests","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" filter is used. The ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Latest launches","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" option is selected, along with the following levels: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"build, platform, team","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". It is possible to mix attributes from both the launch and test levels, as launch-level attributes are automatically propagated by ReportPortal to all its children.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1Tfne6Cycly8VVTdjPaxu","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Once the widget is created, additional time may be required to process a large amount of data. Afterward, it becomes possible to drill down to the next levels, revealing grouped test results and additional information about statistics and defects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6JAEforTtHcKOKBFdpdtp","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Both Component Health checks are extremely powerful and can cover many of your needs, but let's look at the other useful widgets that ReportPortal offers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Widgets by purpose","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Analytics for a single test run","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gain actionable insights into individual test runs with these three essential widgets, designed to highlight key metrics such as pass rates, flaky tests, and time-consuming cases.

","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/PassingRatePerLaunch/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Passing rate per launch","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

While this widget is simple, it clearly provides main information about the results of the last run.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6ZGx47VvlbpDqw4fcvNgUP","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/FlakyTestCasesTableTop50/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Flaky test cases table","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

This widget is useful for pinpointing unstable autotests that yield different statuses with each execution. Next, we need to consider: could the issue be with the autotest rather than the product itself? It is recommended to pay attention to flaky tests as they affect the stability of the test automation.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7g1SifDuy8nCGCoEEqaxuu","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/MostTimeConsumingTestCasesWidgetTop20/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Most time-consuming test cases","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

It's beneficial to use this in conjunction with the Launches duration chart: whenever we notice that a launch is taking an extended amount of time, we can build the Most Time-Consuming Test Cases widget by the name of this launch and identify which test cases are taking the longest and think about their optimization.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3sORuV5R4QJofAxqCVvoBs","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Aggregated analytics from several launches","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Explore key widgets that provide a comprehensive view of aggregated analytics across multiple launches, offering valuable insights into trends, growth, and overall statistics.

","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/CumulativeTrendChart/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Cumulative trend chart","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

You can observe the changes in statistics from one build to another, or from one version to the next. leadParagraph.leadParagraph: The first step in using ReportPortal is reporting your test results. For example, results can be sent to ReportPortal through test frameworks for Java, JavaScript, .NET, Python, PHP, and others.
